decks.notes: This deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with powerful and efficient green creatures. By playing aggressive creatures like Yorvo, Lord of Garenbrig and Questing Beast early on, alongside mana accelerants like Pelt Collector and Barkhide Troll, it aims to put pressure on the opponent's life total. The inclusion of cards like Gemrazer and The Great Henge provides additional utility and value, allowing for further flexibility and card advantage. With a strong creature base and supporting spells, this deck aims to swiftly close out games before the opponent can stabilize.

The main focus of this Mono Green Aggro deck is to quickly establish a board presence with efficient creatures such as Lovestruck Beast, Questing Beast, and Stonecoil Serpent. The deck also includes cards like The Great Henge and Vivien, Arkbow Ranger to provide card advantage and additional utility. With a mana base consisting entirely of Forests and Castle Garenbrig, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures and potentially finish the game quickly.

The main focus of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures like Seasoned Hallowblade, Alpine Houndmaster, and Legion Warboss, while protecting them with cards like Selfless Savior and Alseid of Life's Bounty. Winota, Joiner of Forces is included to generate additional value by potentially putting even more creatures onto the battlefield. The deck also features a strong removal package with Bonecrusher Giant and Embercleave. The mana base is optimized to support the fast-paced Boros Aggro strategy.

The deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly to play powerful spells and creatures, with a strong emphasis on card advantage and synergy between cards. It aims to flood the board with threats and overwhelm the opponent with large creatures and powerful spells, using cards like Omnath, Locus of the Roil, Ugin, the Spirit Dragon, and Genesis Ultimatum to create a board presence that is difficult to deal with. It also utilizes the companion Yorion, Sky Nomad to provide additional value and resilience to removal.

This deck focuses on using sacrifice and synergy between creatures and permanents to control the board and disrupt the opponent's game plan. By utilizing cards like Cauldron Familiar, Woe Strider, Mayhem Devil, and Priest of Forgotten Gods in conjunction with Witch's Oven and Trail of Crumbs, the deck aims to generate value through sacrificing creatures and triggering powerful effects. The addition of Jegantha, the Wellspring as a companion allows for an additional source of mana while maintaining the deck's consistency. Overall, the deck aims to grind out value while preventing the opponent from establishing a strong board presence.

The main concept of this Orzhov Control deck is to gain advantage by disrupting the opponent's hand and board state through cards like Yarok's Fenlurker, Burglar Rat, and Basilica Bell-Haunt. It utilizes multiple copies of Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion to maximize the value of enter-the-battlefield triggers from cards like Charming Prince and Oath of Kaya. The deck also focuses on removing threats with cards such as Mortify, Heartless Act, and Grasp of Darkness, while maintaining control and card advantage with Doom Foretold and Treacherous Blessing. The deck's mana base includes Castle Ardenvale, Temple of Silence, Godless Shrine, Fabled Passage, and Castle Locthwain.

The deck revolves around utilizing small, evasive creatures and countermagic to apply early pressure on the opponent while maintaining control of the game. By ramping with cards like Growth Spiral and Gilded Goose, the deck is able to quickly deploy powerful threats like Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and Nightpack Ambusher. This allows the deck to adapt to various situations, whether it's aggressively attacking with flying creatures like Brazen Borrower or playing a more defensive game with counter spells like Mystical Dispute and Rewind. The deck aims to outpace and outmaneuver opponents while maintaining a solid defensive strategy.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game through countering spells, card draw, and efficiently ramping up mana using Wilderness Reclamation and Growth Spiral. The deck aims to stall the opponent while setting up a powerful win condition with cards like Expansion / Explosion and Shark Typhoon. By efficiently managing resources and disrupting the opponent's game plan, this deck seeks to control the pace of the game and outvalue the opponent in the late game.

This Bant Control deck aims to establish strong board presence and card advantage by utilizing powerful planeswalkers like Teferi and Nissa, along with efficient spells like Shark Typhoon and Uro. The deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly with cards like Growth Spiral and Uro, while also maintaining control of the board with removal spells like Shatter the Sky and Elspeth Conquers Death. With a strong mix of card draw, counterspells, and threats, this deck aims to outvalue and outlast opponents in a long game.

This deck focuses on controlling the game by using powerful planeswalkers, removal spells, and card draw to outvalue the opponent. It aims to stabilize the board with efficient creatures like Uro and Hydroid Krasis, while using counterspells and sweepers like Shatter the Sky to maintain control. The deck also includes ways to generate card advantage with Narset and Shark Typhoon, as well as generate mana advantage with Nissa. By combining these tools, the deck seeks to constantly disrupt the opponent's game plan and ultimately win through card advantage and overwhelming threats.

This Gruul Aggro deck focuses on flooding the board with powerful creatures like Questing Beast and Gemrazer, supported by mana acceleration from cards like Paradise Druid and Gilded Goose. Legion Warboss and Scavenging Ooze provide additional pressure while cards like Domri, Chaos Bringer and Vivien, Arkbow Ranger offer support and card advantage. The deck also includes removal spells like Bonecrusher Giant and Embercleave to help control the board. Overall, this deck aims to overwhelm its opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy.

This deck focuses on sacrificing creatures for value and utilizing the synergy between cards like Witch's Oven, Cauldron Familiar, and Mayhem Devil to consistently deal damage to the opponent. With cards like Priest of Forgotten Gods and Claim the Firstborn, the deck can disrupt the opponent's game plan while generating card advantage. The combination of aggressive creatures like Gutterbones and Woe Strider, along with the recursive nature of the deck, allows for a fast-paced playstyle that can overwhelm the opponent. The key strategy is to maintain board control and pressure the opponent with constant threats and damage.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of aggressive creatures and disruptive spells. The deck focuses on tempo plays, utilizing control elements like Lofty Denial and Rewind to protect its creatures and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The inclusion of cards like Nissa, Who Shakes the World and Ugin, the Ineffable provide additional value and late-game power. Overall, the deck aims to quickly establish board presence and maintain pressure on the opponent to secure a victory.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly build up a board presence with aggressive creatures while disrupting your opponent's game plan with countermagic and bounce spells. Utilizing powerful creatures like Nightpack Ambusher and Brazen Borrower, along with tempo plays like Rewind and Lofty Denial, you aim to apply pressure early and control the game. With the ability to generate card advantage through cards like Growth Spiral and Castle Vantress, the deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver your opponent to secure victory in a Standard 1 vs 1 match.

The main strategy of this deck is to control the game by countering opponents' spells, using removal and generating card advantage. The deck aims to ramp up with Growth Spiral and Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath, and then take advantage of Wilderness Reclamation to generate a high amount of mana to cast powerful spells like Expansion / Explosion and Shark Typhoon. Nightpack Ambusher provides a threat on the board, while Brazen Borrower offers versatility. The deck aims to outvalue the opponent and maintain control of the game until it can win with its powerful spells.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through counterspells, removal, and card draw, while also ramping up mana with Wilderness Reclamation and Growth Spiral to cast powerful threats like Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and Shark Typhoon. The deck aims to outvalue the opponent by generating card advantage and creating a board state that is difficult to overcome. With a mix of interaction, ramp, and threats, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while advancing its own towards victory.
